info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 7 at 4:39PM CDT until September 7 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of South Texas, including the following county, Victoria.
* WHEN...Until 645 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some intersections may be closed.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 437 PM CDT, the public reported standing water from previous heavy rains in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in additional minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Victoria, Guadalupe, Wood Hi, Brentwood Subdivision, Victoria Colony Creek Country Club, Victoria College, Downtown Victoria and Victoria Riverside Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT THIS EVENING
